publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-742# Mark Ballard: Food for Good-That the Parliament commends UNISON on the production of its "Food for Good Charter" and considers that NHS Scotland should adopt the targets set out therein for organic produce, animal welfare and fair trade and accept the UNISON Food for Good recommendations on meat quality, five portions of fruit and vegetables a day, recycling and composting, patients not profit, resources, real food and fair pay as policy.
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Ms Sandra White*

S2M-742# Mark Ballard: Food for Good-That the Parliament commends UNISON on the production of its "Food for Good Charter" and considers that NHS Scotland should adopt the targets set out therein for organic produce, animal welfare and fair trade and accept the UNISON Food for Good recommendations on meat quality, five portions of fruit and vegetables a day, recycling and composting, patients not profit, resources, real food and fair pay as policy. Supported by: Ms Sandra White, Frances Curran*, Tommy Sheridan*, Carolyn Leckie*, Margaret Jamieson*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Shiona Baird*, Patrick Harvie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Elaine Smith*, Robin Harper*, Marlyn Glen*, Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Alex Neil*
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Colin Fox*
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Rosie Kane*
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Scott Barrie* R
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Shona Robison*, Susan Deacon*
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Nicola Sturgeon*

S2M-742# Mark Ballard: Food for Good-That the Parliament commends UNISON on the production of its "Food for Good Charter" and considers that NHS Scotland should adopt the targets set out therein for organic produce, animal welfare and fair trade and accept the UNISON Food for Good recommendations on meat quality, five portions of fruit and vegetables a day, recycling and composting, patients not profit, resources, real food and fair pay as policy. Supported by: Ms Sandra White, Frances Curran, Tommy Sheridan, Carolyn Leckie, Margaret Jamieson, Eleanor Scott, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Shiona Baird, Patrick Harvie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Chris Ballance, Elaine Smith, Robin Harper, Marlyn Glen, Mr Mark Ruskell, Donald Gorrie, Alex Neil, Colin Fox, Dr Jean Turner, Rosie Kane, Scott Barrie R, Shona Robison, Susan Deacon, Nicola Sturgeon
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Rob Gibson*
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) John Swinburne*
S2M-742# Food for Good (lodged on 16 December 2003) Jackie Baillie*, Pauline McNeill*
